alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued November 24 at 12:10PM PST until November 25 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST SATURDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 expected. For the Frost Advisory, temperatures between 33 and 36 degrees will be conducive for frost formation. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast. Frost conditions expected along the immediate coast from Coos Bay south to Port Orford early Friday, with more widespread frost expected Saturday from north of Reedsport down to near Port Orford. Freezing conditions through much of inland Coos County, including Myrtle Point, Coos Bay, Coquille, and Powers on Saturday. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 9 AM PST Saturday. Frost is possible again Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
